A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions have not been answered by anyone else; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces.

Use extra sheets of paper if there is not sufficient space to answer the questions. Don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct, as you have given it, please say so. It is quite acceptable to have someone else do the writing at your direction.

1. Your full name: MRS. LENORA COWEN (MRS. CHARLES)
2. Your address: SILTAN, SASK.
3. Date: JAN. 4, 1955.
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): OTTAWA, ONT.
5. What was your father's name and occupation?: G.N. SWANNSTON, Mechanic.
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and Year): April 1887.
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible.: OTTAWA, ONT.
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you say "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc).: 10 years old.
9. What were your reasons for coming West?: Came with the family.
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government Information?): My Father learned of it from Mr. Ellis. He appelle land agent.
